Mercury Cadmium Telluride.name: Mercury Cadmium Telluride
Mercury Cadmium Telluride.description: II-VI alloy semiconductor with bandgap tuned via Cadmium mole fraction (x). Key material for high-performance SWIR/MWIR/LWIR detectors, typically requiring cryogenic cooling. Preferred substrate: CdZnTe (~4% Zn).

safety.toxicity: High (Contains Hg, Cd). Follow strict safety protocols.
safety.handling: Requires PPE, fume hood/glovebox, hazardous waste disposal.

identification.phase_diagram_notes: Pseudo-binary. Narrow liquidus-solidus gap (esp. x~0.2). Critical Hg partial pressure control needed during processing.

growth_fabrication_properties.common_growth_methods: LPE (Te-rich, ~450-500C), MBE (~180-210C, precise), MOCVD (~350-400C, Hg precursor needed).
growth_fabrication_properties.source_materials_purity: Elemental Hg, Cd, Te (typically >6N purity essential for high performance).
growth_fabrication_properties.preferred_substrates_orientations: Substrate: CdZnTe (~4% Zn) optimal; Si, GaAs, Ge, Sapphire usable with buffer layers. Orientation: (111)B for LPE; (211)B, (100) for MBE/MOCVD.
growth_fabrication_properties.typical_growth_parameters: Method/x dependent. Rates: ~1-5 um/hr (MBE/MOCVD). Requires precise Temp. and Hg flux/pressure control.
growth_fabrication_properties.passivation_methods: Essential for stability/performance. Common: ZnS, CdTe, SiO2 via Sputtering, MBE, MOCVD, ALD etc.

post_growth_processing.annealing: CRITICAL step. Purpose: Reduce Hg vacancies, activate p-dopants (As), improve crystallinity. Temps: ~200-450C (depends on goal/x). Requires Hg overpressure.
post_growth_processing.lapping_polishing: Lapping: Al2O3/SiC slurries. Polishing: Fine diamond slurries (<1um) or CMP (e.g., Br-Methanol). Use low pressure (brittle).
post_growth_processing.etching: Wet: Br-Methanol, Br-Ethylene Glycol, Lactic/Nitric/HF mixes. Dry: RIE/ICP (CH4/H2, Ar, halogens) for patterning.
post_growth_processing.grinding_milling: Generally avoided for wafers (brittleness/contamination). Careful use for source prep possible.

band_gap.notes: Tunable via x. Target: x≈0.2 LWIR (~0.1eV), x≈0.3 MWIR (~0.25eV).

bandgap_equation.hansen_eg: Eg(x,T) Empirical Eq. (See Hansen et al.)

electrical_properties.common_dopants: n-type: In (10^14-10^16 cm^-3). p-type: As, Au, Hg-vacancies (10^15-10^17 cm^-3).

carrier_concentration.notes: Strong Temp. dependence. Extrinsic via doping.

optical_properties.spectral_range: SWIR, MWIR, LWIR (0.8 um to >30 um)

refractive_index.notes: High index. Varies with λ, x.

responsivity.notes: At 77K. Depends on λ, bias, etc.

operating_temperature.notes: Reduces dark current for optimal S/N.

chemical_properties.stability_oxidation: Surface unstable without passivation; readily oxidizes.
chemical_properties.etching: Wet: Br-Methanol, Br-Ethylene Glycol, Acid mixes. Dry: RIE/ICP (CH4/H2, Ar, Halogens).
